Posts.EditableText:
Hey everyone.  My name's David, and I just decided to join the forum to get involved with the Quest community.  I've uploaded one game, Sandbox Samurai, using QDK Lite.  I haven't bought the full version simply because I can't afford it.

Just thought I'd introduce myself.
Posts.HTML:

Just thought I'd introduce myself.

Posts.EditableText: [quote="vain one.. I mean Paul_one":2h4dfa6n]I was very tempted to take a picture of myself fresh out the shower[/quote:2h4dfa6n] Thanks for sharing.. err... thanks for NOT sharing. haha As dashing as my body is, I don't think I ever have been tempted to take a picture of it fresh out of the shower... My wife probably wouldn't be too thrilled of me doing it either. haha [quote="DavidRevelle":2h4dfa6n]Sandbox Samurai, using QDK Lite[/quote:2h4dfa6n] Hey David, I like the black background of the game and you seem to be mostly grammatically sound. I want to know though, was the game working properly when you uploaded it? I mean was there a way to get to the end? Do you mind giving a few tips on getting through it? I looked at it on QDK and I don't see how some of the objects will actually work. I don't see how the TV can be turned on, for instance. "turn on TV" isn't recognized. I noticed in a couple different objects (twig, mousechuk) that there are commands or something entered in the action tab of the object's properties. I have no idea what it does or how it works. I saw something else startling in that tab also. There are commands that reference ~internal procedure 25 or 24, etc... yet under the game's procedure list, there are no procedures. I'm asking all this because it appears some thought went into this game and I am curious what it is supposed to be doing. [quote="Michael the gamer":2h4dfa6n]Very Nice game for a Newbie to make congrats. If I have time I will put a rating of 4[/quote:2h4dfa6n] Not to question your mighty rating procedure but does this rating of 4 mean you were able to play through to the end? Could you post a tutorial? Just curious.

Posts.EditableText: Well it might be because I tried to make what I wanted to happen work one way and I couldn't get it to so I found an alternate way and simply forgot to delete it another way. Anyway, I'll go ahead and post a walkthrough. 1) Open DVD player. 2) Take DVD. 3) Move SW to Sister's Room. 4) Look under bed. 5) Open Scrapbooking Kit. 6) Type "cut dvd with scissors" 6.5) Take mouse. 7) Move NE. Move NW. 9) Turn on the sink, then the bathtub. 10) Move SE. 11) Go Up. 12) Open drawer. 13) Take object. 14) Go down. 15) Go out. 16) Take Twig, 17) Type either "tape object to twig" or "tape twig to object" 18) Use the Sandbox. That should do it. If that doesn't work let me know; that was all from memory.
Posts.HTML:
Well it might be because I tried to make what I wanted to happen work one way and I couldn't get it to so I found an alternate way and simply forgot to delete it another way. Anyway, I'll go ahead and post a walkthrough.

1) Open DVD player.
2) Take DVD.
3) Move SW to Sister's Room.
4) Look under bed.
5) Open Scrapbooking Kit.
6) Type "cut dvd with scissors"
6.5) Take mouse.
7) Move NE.
Move NW.
9) Turn on the sink, then the bathtub.
10) Move SE.
11) Go Up.
12) Open drawer.
13) Take object.
14) Go down.
15) Go out.
16) Take Twig,
17) Type either "tape object to twig" or "tape twig to object"
18) Use the Sandbox.

That should do it. If that doesn't work let me know; that was all from memory.

I mean Paul_one":3l9laxja]I was very tempted to take a picture of myself fresh out the shower[/quote:3l9laxja] Thanks for sharing.. err... thanks for NOT sharing. haha As dashing as my body is, I don't think I ever have been tempted to take a picture of it fresh out of the shower... My wife probably wouldn't be too thrilled of me doing it either. haha [/quote:3l9laxja] Awww c'mon Steve, I'm sure your wife would be thrilled to have that santa's-hat-only picture of you on the end of the bed . ... not like I stole it or anything *gulp* [quote:3l9laxja]Say, have you been into a eating contest lately? Like the first one to eat a 5kg of Ham If so what things have you won?[/quote:3l9laxja] Nope, no eating contests. Actually, I really only eat when I'm at home - that is properly anyway. While I'm out I might have snack bars, packets of crisps, biscuits and sausage rolls.. On the odd occasion I go into a good pub or restaurant I'll have salmon, or gammon steak, or beef steak, etc. All proper food. No fast food (burgers, pizzas, etc). No currys (or other indian, or chinese or tai-food). Mostly, I love cooking for myself - chicken, beef stew, cottage pie, pork chops.. Haven't really gotten into 'fancy food' but I may try my versatile hands some day. [EDIT] HAHAHA, I just noticed your comment Steve (vain one).. Oooo, you just wait till I put a sheep into that photo!!

No fast food (burgers, pizzas, etc). No currys (or other indian, or chinese or tai-food).
Mostly, I love cooking for myself - chicken, beef stew, cottage pie, pork chops.. Haven't really gotten into 'fancy food' but I may try my versatile hands some day.

That should do it. If that doesn't work let me know; that was all from memory.

What is the point of your question?  Don't answer that, it's rhetorical.
For your information, despite the fact that Quest 4 has been out for a year or so, I have not played with it and I had no idea that there were limitations.  I opened it once when it first came out and decided I would wait to learn how to use the new one (if there were differences).  I haven't been making any games in that long either.  I got back into it when the Christmas contest was announced.

As a hint to you, if you do not wish for people to make fun of you on here, I suggest that if you have a question that really only pertains to me, send me a message and I will reply.
